title: panic: runtime error: index out of range
body:
May I upgrade to lastest version?

System information

Geth version: `v1.7.3-stable`
OS & Version: Ubuntu 16.04.4 
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour


Actual behaviour
crash

Steps to reproduce the behaviour
sudo ./geth --datadir /mnt/ethereum --rpc --rpcaddr 0.0.0.0 --rpcport 18759 --rpcapi eth,net,web3,personal,db console

Backtrace
`INFO [12-24|02:18:51] Starting peer-to-peer node               instance=Geth/v1.7.3-stable-4bb3c89d/linux-amd64/go1.9.2
INFO [12-24|02:18:51] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/mnt/ethereum/geth/chaindata cache=128 handles=1024
panic: runtime error: index out of range

        /home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/vendor/github.com/syndtr/goleveldb/leveldb/version.go:279 +0x7a

        /home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/vendor/gopkg.in/urfave/cli.v1/app.go:490 +0xd2

main.main()

> May I upgrade to lastest version?

yes please do and reopen this issue if you still face it
